bio: John is a classically trained chef with a passion for creating delicious and innovative dishes. He has worked in top restaurants around the world and has won numerous awards for his culinary creations.

recipes.name: Seared Salmon with Roasted Vegetables
recipes.cookingMethod: Preheat oven to 425°F. Toss vegetables with olive oil and garlic and spread on a baking sheet. Season salmon fillets with salt and pepper, then sear in a hot skillet until crispy on both sides. Transfer salmon to baking sheet with vegetables and roast for 12-15 minutes until cooked through. Squeeze fresh lemon juice over salmon and vegetables before serving.

recipes.name: Beef Wellington
recipes.cookingMethod: Preheat oven to 425°F. Sear beef tenderloin in a hot skillet until browned on all sides, then set aside. Saute chopped mushrooms, shallots, and garlic in the same skillet until softened, then set aside to cool. Roll out puff pastry and spread cooled mushroom mixture over the center. Place seared beef tenderloin on top of the mushroom mixture, then wrap the pastry around the beef. Brush with beaten egg and bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the pastry is golden brown and the beef is cooked to your liking.
